reviews.review_title: Strange members of staff with their strange rules here
reviews.negative_text:
1st. The man on reception speaks French only. A strange man.
2nd. You can't switch off the AC. I did set it on maximum temperature 32 ¬∞C and opened the window. The room was still too cold at night when I was sitting down and sorting out things on my tablet etc. I have got sick on the following days with cold symptoms. The worst is - when I have to run around the town searching for a toilet because of a sudden urgent need, every hour or more often. I don't have that problem usually. I'm a white European, age 63 with a lot of travelling experience. I'm from a Northern country. 
3rd. There isn't a holder fitted for the shower head in any of the rooms. You have to hold it in your hand. Some strange rule.
4th. No soundproof. You can hear what's happening outside and what other people are doing inside. 
5th. You can't leave your bags for any length of time after the check-out. I have been travelling around South of France since last year staying in probably 40 hotels. I do leave my 2 small bags because there are no lockers or left luggage offices in stations as a rule. Luckily there is one in this town. 
6th. Before my check-out a lady was called in the reception because she spoke a little English. I spoke to her regarding my complaints. She just dismissed them. During my check-out a little later I asked to leave my 2 bags. She and the man were making a bed in 1 room. She just said: "It's closed! Bye." What a Good bye.

reviews.positive_text:
It is a fantastic location, literally a 3 minute walk from the station and around the corner from the beach, shops and restaurants. The staff were lovely and helpful and the bed was very comfortable.
It's a great price so don't expect chic opulence, but definitely clean and absolutely adequate ... but a bit of a squeeze. It wasn't a problem though.
The stairs up to the 3rd floor are a bit of a workout with luggage so something to be aware of if that's a problem and ask for a 1st floor room.
very convenient to the beach and the train station, i was allowed to check in early which is nice
reviews.negative_text: small room, uncomrfotable bed, bare minimum from staff- they not help my freind carry luggage up stairs. Only one key which made it complicated to enter when two people. after leaving, staff also made vague threats and were incredibly rude.

reviews.positive_text: The location,air conditioning
reviews.negative_text: We carried our huge luggage up 4 flights of stairs, the room really needs upgrading..No tea/ coffee facilities. Tiny, single ,Z beds.

reviews.positive_text: Nice and clean room. Good location.
Convenient and clean
reviews.negative_text: All good

reviews.positive_text: nice
reviews.negative_text: everything fine

reviews.positive_text: Optimal location very close to train station and to the beach. Passable for a one-night stay if willing to avoid the very high average prices of Cote d'Azur.
reviews.negative_text: Old and not well maintained facilities, dark moquette on the bedroom floor that did not look very clean and is not easily cleanable in general, dark colour towels so impossible to thoroughly inspect their cleanliness, found hair on one pillow. Staff could not speak a word of English which is not acceptable for such a famous and international location as St. Raphael, nor they did anything to make me feel welcome, check in was not easy for just a 15 minutes delay due to a late train, breakfast was very bad and very overpaid.

reviews.positive_text: Wonderful small hotel, great location near the train station and beach. Such a comfortable and lovely room. Staff were very friendly. We would highly recommend this hotel and would love to come back again!

Lovely stay in an older family run hotel.  We had everything we needed for a comfortable stay‚Äîgood ac and an overhead fan for good temperature control on some very hot days.  The family was very accommodating. Location is steps away from the boardwalk and sandy beaches, along with many restaurants and coffee bars. It is on a noisy street, but the windows blocked out all the sound. We had breakfast for 8 euros each one day with nice choices.  For the price, we considered it a great deal. We stayed 5 nights. St Raphael is a wonderful family oriented beach town.
reviews.negative_text: Unfortunately they do not have an elevator.  There are 3 flights above ground level.  Not much of a view from the windows, but the location makes up for it.

reviews.positive_text: The location is insane. Small, cute and simple hotel, very clean and nice staff. Would totally recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Worst stay on the Riviera in 20 years.
reviews.positive_text: Only location, nothing else.
reviews.negative_text: The worst stay on the Riviera ever. The room, charged 100 euros per night,  was small, the bed was not long enough - I couldn't stretch on the bed as it was 170 cm long and I am 168 cm. My feet were touching the iron bedstead. The paint on the wall needs refreshment. The kettle in the room was not operating properly and even if I asked to change it, the new one was the same, taken from another room. The wardrobe in the room dates back to a few decades backwards, not closing properly. The bathroom needs refreshment - the shower has a plastic curtain instead of a door, so water spreads all around. The view from my room (n¬∞11) was on air conditioning of all the guests, very loud and noisy during the day and at night. Also, the noise insulation needs something to be done - every passage of a guest could be heard, and any visit to the toilet / shower  of a neighbor was audible, waking me up at night.  The staff avoided contact with guests, hiding in their private premises. I couldn't even change after the beach in a guest toilet after giving up the room in the morning. The result : I had to change from beachwear to ordinary clothes in front of the glass front door. I couldn't use the toilet, either. Not very welcoming. The owner also refused to agree to take the key from me on the last day at 7.30 so I had to wait until 8 o'clock. I have only bad memories of this stay and I do not recommend this hotel to anybody.
